paper_metadata.title: Impact of unconditional cash transfers on educational investments and access in Rwanda

program_information.program_name_citation: We draw on an independent evaluation of the Concern Worldwide Graduation Programme, which supported beneficiaries with monthly cash transfers and livelihood training.
program_information.country_citation: This paper explores the short and medium term impacts of unconditional cash transfers on school-related choices for children of beneficiary households in Rwanda.
program_information.target_population_citation: Empirically, this paper draws on data from the Concern Worldwide Graduation programme in Rwanda, which supported beneficiary households with unconditional cash transfers over a period of 12 months, and livelihood training for 24 months.

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Empirically, this paper draws on data from the Concern Worldwide Graduation programme in Rwanda, which supported beneficiary households with unconditional cash transfers over a period of 12 months

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Our study finds that the programme enabled poor households to overcome income constraints and, consequently, allowed them to make investments in education.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: The paper benefits from a quasi-experimental design in which households were selected to participate in the programme and a comparable control group was also followed over the same period.
